intro: Portulaca molokiniensis, commonly known as the Molokini prickly pear, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a succulent species that belongs to the Portulacaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in arid and well-drained conditions. Its flowers are usually bright red or yellow, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. The species is adapted to withstand high salinity and strong winds, making it a hardy plant in its native habitat.
